text: There were many others in the past who lived longer than you might expect, {nl}but Agailla Flurry is the first to have lived a long life by her own design.

name: QUEST_20150317_000672
text: The Pedigree of Magic

name: QUEST_20150317_000673
text: Magic, at the beginning, began from the investigation of mana {nl}and the review of basic elements.

name: QUEST_20150317_000674
text: After that, the basic senses, religious belief of the goddesses, {nl}and mathematical approaches were mixed to find areas for expansion.

name: QUEST_20150317_000675
text: The research twisted previous notions of time and space, {nl}which were beyond the changes of the body, {nl}and the rules of physics and the elements progressed significantly.

name: QUEST_20150317_000676
text: The Report of the High Barrier Magic

name: QUEST_20150317_000677
text: The barrier in this tower could not have possibly been created by the Demon Lord alone.

name: QUEST_20150317_000678
text: It acts like a tight-knit net. {nl}Someone with a normal level of divine power cannot escape from it.

name: QUEST_20150317_000679
text: For what reason was this barrier created?{nl}Is it related to the fact that the goddess who controls the flames of this world is staying here?

name: QUEST_20150317_000680
text: Agailla Flurry called Gabija to this tower, so this barrier is not meant to lock Gabija in. {nl}To find out the reason for this, we first have to understand the composition of the barrier.

name: QUEST_20150317_000681
text: After a long investigation, we've found that this barrier was {nl}not only created with the power of Helgasercle, but rather blended with mana of different wavelengths.

name: QUEST_20150317_000682
text: We've also found that mana was composed by aligning the foundation stones in a certain position.

name: QUEST_20150317_000683
text: We were able to retrieve some of those foundation stones from various areas in the kingdom. {nl}The new information that we learned from them was astonishing.

name: QUEST_20150317_000684
text: The mana provided to use barrier magic wasn't voluntary. {nl}We theorize that the levels of the Demon Lords were divided and sealed into the foundation stones and aligned into a position.

name: QUEST_20150317_000685
text: The key to unlock this barrier is in the foundation. {nl}We'll continue to search for the answer after we block Helgasercle's invasion.

name: QUEST_20150317_000686
text: The Understanding of Mana

name: QUEST_20150317_000687
text: Unlike priests who control the blessing of the goddess directly, {nl}the wizard is defined as a person who releases various magic information or the blessing of the goddess.

name: QUEST_20150317_000688
text: Okay so, what is mana? {nl}We can say the true quality of mana is the life force on this land. {nl}The life force of nature. It doesn't just imply the length of lives.

name: QUEST_20150317_000689
text: The life force is a form of energy that composes this world and it spreads like branches to various places in the world. {nl}If you could find the source of that energy, you may obtain astonishing power.

name: QUEST_20150317_000690
text: The Diary of Antares' Investigation

name: QUEST_20150317_000691
text: As I was investigating mana, I discovered one important fact: {nl}The mana which flows steadily in the Mage Tower behaves strangely on the top of the tower

name: QUEST_20150317_000692
text: After lengthy research, I found out that there is a third type of energy which is {nl}different from the types of mana we know of, and it has a shape of a specific object.

name: QUEST_20150317_000693
text: This object must be from the era of Agailla Flurry as no one knows the existence of this object.

name: QUEST_20150317_000694
text: I am sure that this object will bring a new beginning of magic, {nl}but since it is separated at the highest place atop the tower, we have no way to reach it.

name: QUEST_20150317_000695
text: We can't demolish the tower nor destroy part of it just to get it.

name: QUEST_20150317_000696
text: I will end my writing by stating that this object has more to be investigated.

name: QUEST_20150317_000697
text: Potter's Clay Tablet

name: QUEST_20150317_000698
text: I hope Fedimian is restored to its previous state before I die. {nl}At least, I hope I can make thousands of potteries with a wish in each of them.

name: QUEST_20150317_000699
text: Girl's Clay Tablet

name: QUEST_20150317_000700
text: I hope you find your lost brother at the Goddess' Ancient Garden.

name: QUEST_20150317_000701
text: Commander Willis' Clay Tablet

name: QUEST_20150317_000702
text: I pray to the goddess that I can continue my work as an administration officer in the city. {nl}I don't like the work as a dispatched worker.

name: QUEST_20150317_000703
text: Klaipeda Farmer's Clay Tablet

name: QUEST_20150317_000704
text: I want to take back my farm and experience the challenge of potato farming again.

name: QUEST_20150317_000705
text: Soldier's Clay Tablet

name: QUEST_20150317_000706
text: I hope Ryudas gets called up to the military. {nl}I hope the supplies come in time at the battlefield!

name: QUEST_20150317_000707
text: I hope we can recapture Kateen Forest. {nl}I hope we never encounter Deadborn.

name: QUEST_20150317_000708
text: Ranger Master's Clay Tablet

name: QUEST_20150317_000709
text: I don't like Fiona and wonder why she's the Hunter Master. {nl}But, if we need her to defeat Ebonypawn, I'm fine with allying with her.

name: QUEST_20150317_000710
text: Coben's Clay Tablet

name: QUEST_20150317_000711
text: I pray to the goddess that I find my lost brother again. {nl}We could open another bar and spend all day there listening to his heroic stories.

name: QUEST_20150317_000712
text: Kevin's Clay Tablet

name: QUEST_20150317_000713
text: I hope I can make it big out of the excavation site of Zachariel's Royal Mausoleum...

name: QUEST_20150317_000714
text: Uska's Clay Tablet

name: QUEST_20150317_000715
text: Goddess.{nl}As the commander that leads the knights, I hope I can protect Klaipeda myself.

name: QUEST_20150317_000716
text: Wizard Master's Clay Tablet

name: QUEST_20150317_000717
text: I will become a Wizard Master some day. {nl}And then I will become a great wizard like Agailla Flurry.

name: QUEST_20150317_000718
text: Clay Tablet with a wish in it

name: QUEST_20150317_000719
text: It is all due to the blessing of the goddess that we {nl}were able to avoid Medzio Diena in Andale Village. {nl}I hope our village is happy and flourishes from now on.

name: QUEST_20150317_000720
text: Titas' Clay Tablet

name: QUEST_20150317_000721
text: I hope the Revelators I've met find the goddesses. {nl}I don't understand why I couldn't become a Revelator myself though.

name: QUEST_20150317_000722
text: Paladin Master's Clay Tablet

name: QUEST_20150317_000723
text: I beg to the goddess. {nl}I hope the day where the Watchers collect my pledge never comes...

name: QUEST_20150317_000724
text: Cyrenia Odell's Clay Tablet

name: QUEST_20150317_000725
text: I hope I can solve the secret of the Royal Mausoleum of Zachariel.

name: QUEST_20150317_000726
text: While I am dispatched, I pray to the goddess that I never get cursed by petrification.

name: QUEST_20150317_000727
text: Pilgrim's Clay Tablet

name: QUEST_20150317_000728
text: I am going to the Great Cathedral to pledge my marriage with him. {nl}I hope the Pilgrim's Way is safe.

name: QUEST_20150317_000729
text: Wizard's Clay Tablet

name: QUEST_20150317_000730
text: Helgasercle, stop attacking!

name: QUEST_20150317_000731
text: Zachariel's Fragment

name: QUEST_20150317_000732
text: Forever shine, my Kingdom!

name: QUEST_20150317_000733
text: Tesla's First Fragment

name: QUEST_20150317_000734
text: I hope to fulfill my dream of becoming a great sculptor!

name: QUEST_20150317_000735
text: Tesla's Second Fragment

name: QUEST_20150317_000736
text: I hope Sequoia protects the owl well.

name: QUEST_20150317_000737
text: Tesla's Third Fragment

name: QUEST_20150317_000738
text: When I die, I hope my disciples will stand by me.

name: QUEST_20150317_000739
text: Tesla's Fourth Fragment

name: QUEST_20150317_000740
text: Maven. He was such a good friend. I hope he rests in peace beside the goddess...

name: QUEST_20150317_000741
text: Maven's Fragment

name: QUEST_20150317_000742
text: I hope my disciples wish for a great dream without any problems.

name: QUEST_20150317_000743
text: Ruklys' Fragment

name: QUEST_20150317_000744
text: Now is the moment that we become one with our blades. {nl}My last wish is to die beside the one I love.

name: QUEST_20150317_000745
text: Lydia Schaffen's Fragment

name: QUEST_20150317_000746
text: Ruklys... I am sorry.

name: QUEST_20150317_000747
text: Agailla Flurry's Fragment

name: QUEST_20150317_000748
text: Goddess, my mission is too much of a burden on me.

name: QUEST_20150317_000749
text: Premier Eminent's Fragment

name: QUEST_20150317_000750
text: I don't care about wishes. I will strive for myself.

name: QUEST_20150317_000751
text: King Kadumel's Fragment

name: QUEST_20150317_000752
text: Kalejimas. How sweet the word is!

name: QUEST_20150317_000753
text: Rimgaudas' Fragment

name: QUEST_20150317_000754
text: My work will be done once the Tenet Church is completed. {nl}May the goddess guide us until the end.

name: QUEST_20150317_000755
text: Lucid Winterspoon's Fragment

name: QUEST_20150317_000756
text: May my plan be successful and earn me the title of Chronomancer Master.

name: QUEST_20150317_000757
text: Encyclopedia of Masters, Chapter 1

name: QUEST_20150317_000758
text: This book contains information of all current masters. {nl}Publication will continue so look forward to the next book.

name: QUEST_20150317_000759
text: Highlander Master {nl}[Douglas Black] {nl}An experienced general from the noble class who was in charge of the Royal Guards. {nl}As the leader of Highlanders, he worked up front, saving the world from chaos.

name: QUEST_20150317_000760
text: Chronomancer Master {nl} [Lucid Winterspoon] {nl}Alchemist of a prominent family, she refused her title to become a Chronomancer. {nl}No one but the Alchemist Master knows her true age. It is said she's been around since the inauguration ceremony of the Tenet Church.

name: QUEST_20150317_000761
text: Ranger Master {nl} [Nemocen] {nl}Successor to the legendary Lydia Schaffen, is the shooter of tower-born stand-star. {nl}Famous for chasing down assassin, Ebonypawn. Rumor has it he doesn't get along well with Hunter Master, Fiona Ieva.

name: QUEST_20150317_000762
text: Paladin Master {nl} [Valentinas Naimon] {nl}The most well-known hero of the legendary four heroes. {nl}He saved many lives in his verse during Medzio Diena.

name: QUEST_20150317_000763
text: Book Shelf

name: QUEST_20150317_000764
text: (It's too difficult to read.)

name: QUEST_20150317_000765
text: (There are several books on the shelf.{nl}Which book shall I read?)

name: QUEST_20150317_000766
text: (It's under a spell and can't be read.)

name: QUEST_20150317_000767
text: (There are some books worth reading.{nl}Which one shall I read?)

name: QUEST_20150317_000768
text: (There are some books that I can read.{nl}Which one should I read?)

name: QUEST_20150317_000769
text: Pot

name: QUEST_20150317_000770
text: (I can put my hand in this pot.{nl}Which pot should I check?)

name: QUEST_20150317_000771
text: (There is something in the pot. {nl}Which one should I check?)

name: QUEST_20150317_000772
text: (There are some old pots among the new pots. {nl}Which one should I check?)

name: QUEST_20150317_000773
text: (Seems like you can take out the contents of the pot if you turn it upside down.{nl}Which one should I turn?)

name: QUEST_20150317_000774
text: (There are fragments scattered among the pot.{nl}Should I take a look?)

name: QUEST_20150317_000775
text: (There is a clay tablet with writing on it.{nl}Should I take a look?)

name: QUEST_20150317_000776
text: (There is a clay tablet that looks rather new.)

name: QUEST_20150317_000777
text: (There is a clay tablet with writing on it.)

name: QUEST_20150317_000778
text: (The clay tablet looks really old but it can be read.)

name: QUEST_20150317_000779
text: (Found a very old clay tablet.)

name: QUEST_20150317_000780
text: (There is nothing.)

name: QUEST_20150317_000781
text: (Seems like you might break the pot if you mishandle it.)

name: QUEST_20150317_000782
text: (Empty.)

name: QUEST_20150317_000783
text: (A bug came out.)

name: QUEST_20150317_000784
text: (A half-eaten potato came out.)

name: QUEST_20150317_000785
text: (A clay tablet came out, but it's too worn out to be read.)

name: QUEST_20150317_000786
text: Importance of Rest

name: QUEST_20150317_000787
text: Young men nowadays are so restless. {nl}They try to do everything while standing up.

name: QUEST_20150317_000788
text: Whether it be making weapons, making potions, or even cooking, they try to do it while standing. {nl}You must calm yourself and sit in a comfortable position.

name: QUEST_20150317_000789
text: Sit down and prepare all the tools and materials you need. {nl}Remember that creation comes after preparations.

name: QUEST_20150317_000790
text: Goddess Austeja

name: QUEST_20150317_000791
text: Thank you again in the name of the goddess. {nl}Now I will follow the stars in search of Goddess Ausrine.

name: QUEST_20150317_000792
text: It may be better for me to just guard the seal. {nl}But I believe finding all my lost sisters will be the solution to all of this.

name: QUEST_20150317_000793
text: I wish you well... {nl}And may you and this land be blessed.

name: QUEST_20150317_000794
text: Right. I think so too. {nl}The monsters are definitely preying on our honey. {nl}But it is better to have evidence on hand, so bring a piece of beehive {nl}from Saltus Bee Farm.

name: QUEST_20150317_000795
text: Coward

name: QUEST_20150317_000796
text: I'm called a coward but I can't do anything. I'm really scared.

name: QUEST_20150317_000797
text: I see, you're the one the bees have been whispering about. {nl}I am Austeja, the goddess of destiny.

name: QUEST_20150317_000798
text: The seal of this farmland has stabilized, thanks to you. {nl}But the other Revelators have lost themselves due to the evil force flowing from the Spring Light Woods.

name: QUEST_20150317_000799
text: I will be using all of my powers to prevent this from happening any more... {nl}Thus, I cannot move away from here, let alone save them.

name: QUEST_20150317_000800
text: Please save them and the Spring Light Woods.

name: QUEST_20150317_000801
text: Investigation Unit

name: QUEST_20150317_000802
text: Why have so many more monsters appeared?

name: QUEST_20150317_000803
text: The monsters have ruined the entire harvest.

name: QUEST_20150317_000804
text: As you may already know, our kingdom has five major goddesses and other goddesses who{nl}assist them. But nobody knows where all of them are now.

name: QUEST_20150317_000805
text: Flower Shop Lady

name: QUEST_20150317_000806
text: People don't buy flowers anymore. {nl}The only flowers they buy are the ones to offer for the goddesses' return. {nl}It's really depressing in many ways.

name: QUEST_20150317_000807
text: I hope Klaipeda becomes lively like it used to be... {nl}With the fragrance of flowers in the air and people dancing in spring to worship Goddess Zemyna, {nl}the goddess of the Earth...

name: QUEST_20150317_000808
text: Warning

name: QUEST_20150317_000809
text: Beware of Leaf Bugs! They are different from Beetles. {nl}It is hard to fight them when they come in flocks so be careful.

name: QUEST_20150317_000810
text: Notice: Large Kepa is not an onion!{nl}Wearing goggles is useless against Large Kepa. {nl}Watch out for powerful attacks that shake the ground.

name: QUEST_20150317_000811
text: Please worship the Goddess Statue with a pious mind. You will grow stronger with {nl}the Goddess Zemyna's power, blessed by the Overseer of the Earth herself.

name: QUEST_20150317_000812
text: The Statue of Goddess Zemyna lies at the end of this road.

name: QUEST_20150317_000813
text: Warning! Hanaming-infested area. {nl}Do not be fooled by their cute appearance. {nl}They attack in groups and...{nl}(Red marks are covering the rest.)

name: QUEST_20150317_000814
text: Caution! What happens to you beyond this point is your responsibility! {nl}Golems are rumored to appear in this area. Do not go any further.

name: QUEST_20150317_000815
text: P.S. It is better to run away than to pray to the goddess when you encounter Golems.

name: QUEST_20150317_000816
text: The goddesses have disappeared. {nl}But if we fight bravely against the demons, perhaps the goddesses will return someday. {nl} - Laimonas

name: QUEST_20150317_000817
text: Attention to those who come to Klaipeda after having a dream about the revelation. {nl}Knight Commander Uska is waiting for you in the Central Plaza.

name: QUEST_20150317_000818
text: Welcome to Klaipeda Shopping Center. {nl}You can shop for a variety of accessories, tools, equipment, and other items.

name: QUEST_20150317_000819
text: Use the stairs on the right to go to the Klaipeda Central Plaza.

name: QUEST_20150317_000820
text: Klaipeda Central Plaza

name: QUEST_20150317_000821
text: Signboard

name: QUEST_20150317_000822
text: East Siauliai Woods

name: QUEST_20150317_000823
text: It is unknown who the statue honors or how old it is. {nl}But it certainly has mysterious powers that move selected people to other areas.

name: QUEST_20150317_000824
text: Good job. {nl}I have done my task. {nl}It is my time now.

name: QUEST_20150317_000825
text: Go forward. {nl}The Sculptor is waiting for you. {nl}I was glad to have guided you.

name: QUEST_20150317_000826
text: Ah...

name: QUEST_20150317_000827
text: Danger! The vacant lot below these crossroads {nl}has regularly seen dangerous monsters. Entrance is forbidden! {nl} - The Fedimian Market

name: QUEST_20150317_000828
text: People are now praying less and less to the goddesses. {nl}They're losing hope...

name: QUEST_20150317_000829
text: How could I have forgotten you... {nl}Please do not roam around this cursed land {nl}and go to the arms of the goddess.

name: QUEST_20150317_000830
text: Holiday Notice

name: QUEST_20150317_000831
text: I have been enlisted to the army to save the kingdom. {nl}Therefore, the restaurant will be closed in the meantime. {nl} - Owner of Klaipeda's Specialty Restaurant, Vulinya

name: QUEST_20150317_000832
text: Don't blow out the candles. {nl}They guide the souls so they don't lose their way.

name: QUEST_20150317_000833
text: As you know, the King died on Medzio Diena and the fate of other royalty and nobility were no different. {nl}The kingdom is holding together somehow but... now we can only pray.

name: QUEST_20150317_000834
text: Now we can only pray...

name: QUEST_20150317_000835
text: When the spire is bathed with a red light the... door... to fantasy shall be opened.

name: QUEST_20150317_000836
text: King Zachariel's Will

name: QUEST_20150317_000837
text: Dear Revelator. {nl}Listen to the interpretations of the revelation.

name: QUEST_20150317_000838
text: Hmpf... {nl}Who would've thought that I would be challenged by humans...

name: QUEST_20150317_000839
text: Your death shall be utmost painful!

name: QUEST_20150317_000840
text: Soldier Recruitment Notice

name: QUEST_20150317_000841
text: We want you! {nl}Protect your family and your kingdom. {nl} - Klaipeda Recruiting Station

name: QUEST_20150317_000842
text: We are seeking brave young men and women who will bring order to these chaotic times. {nl}The world needs you! {nl} - Klaipeda Recruiting Station

name: QUEST_20150317_000843
text: Honor. {nl}That is what your uniform will be made of. {nl} - Klaipeda Recruiting Station

name: QUEST_20150317_000844
text: Warning! Civilians prohibited.

name: QUEST_20150317_000845
text: Only authorized personnel are allowed inside.

name: QUEST_20150317_000846
text: Impossible.

name: QUEST_20150317_000847
text: Completing this spell will help the soldiers. {nl}Will I be able to make it?

name: QUEST_20150317_000848
text: The soldiers will die if I don't make it. {nl}I have to be strong.

name: QUEST_20150317_000849
text: I can do it. {nl}This time, I will kill Gaigalas.

name: QUEST_20150317_000850
text: Unfortunately, I cannot solve it for you. It is the will of Maven. {nl}However, I am able to give some words of advice.

name: QUEST_20150317_000851
text: The Great Cathedral was built by Silvestro Maven 660 years ago.

name: QUEST_20150317_000852
text: The curse of Naktis... Only curses remain where she treads. {nl}And she is now invading the Great Cathedral in search of the revelation.

name: QUEST_20150317_000853
text: We tried our best to impede them until your arrival. {nl}But as you can see, we've reached our limit.

name: QUEST_20150317_000854
text: Chapel Table

name: QUEST_20150317_000855
text: ...Only after three years since Ruklys learned from my teachings...

name: QUEST_20150317_000856
text: ...two years after the war, my first disciple ended up dead...

name: QUEST_20150317_000857
text: ...year after Lydia Schaffen left the Great Cathedral...

name: QUEST_20150317_000858
text: ...One of the three disciples, Agailla Flurry...

name: QUEST_20150317_000859
text: It has been an old tradition of this town to make pots with wishes inside,{nl}and offer it to the goddess. {nl}Wouldn't this disaster end when the goddess returns?

name: QUEST_20150317_000860
text: The writing on the platform as I recall went like this... {nl}Remember the holy number with your two eyes. {nl}The light of the candles drives away the evil dark.

name: QUEST_20150317_000861
text: Remember the number written on the candle holder. {nl}And light that many candles to solve it.

name: QUEST_20150317_000862
text: The relics have fallen into the demons' hands because of my weakness. {nl}But they shouldn't have reached Naktis yet.

name: QUEST_20150317_000863
text: The other relics and keys are also in danger, so you better move quickly.

name: QUEST_20150317_000864
text: Writings on the Altar

name: QUEST_20150317_000865
text: Everlasting goddess. {nl}May we praise your infinite mercy.

name: QUEST_20150317_000866
text: Life withers and the soul has nowhere to go. {nl}Only the goddess can save us.

name: QUEST_20150317_000867
text: I have sent the bishop there.

name: QUEST_20150317_000868
text: Monsters! Run!

name: QUEST_20150317_000869
text: Maven's Device

name: QUEST_20150317_000870
text: Maven's Device that the bishop talked about. {nl}There is a small keyhole.

name: QUEST_20150317_000871
text: Blue Pawndel

name: QUEST_20150317_000872
text: What is it?

name: QUEST_20150317_000873
text: You're not kidding, are you?

name: QUEST_20150317_000874
text: Black Pawnd

name: QUEST_20150317_000875
text: What's up? {nl}You suspect something?

name: QUEST_20150317_000876
text: Can I trust you?

name: QUEST_20150317_000877
text: Naktis

name: QUEST_20150317_000878
text: I won't hand over the revelation to petty humans!

name: QUEST_20150317_000879
text: Cathedral revelation

name: QUEST_20150317_000880
text: Interpretation of the revelation

name: QUEST_20150317_000881
text: A thousand years ago, before your generation... {nl}This is the story of the time before I left the revelation with the Great King Zachariel.

name: QUEST_20150317_000882
text: This land was full of chaos when the Great King Zachariel tried to raise a new kingdom. {nl}Only one place seemed filled with life, and Zachariel wanted that place.

name: QUEST_20150317_000883
text: But the future I saw in that land had only death and regret. {nl}Thus, I left a prophecy that moved the capital elsewhere {nl}when the kingdom reached a thousand years of age.

name: QUEST_20150317_000884
text: It is now up to the humans to fulfill that prophecy. {nl}The end lies beyond the fog.

name: QUEST_20150317_000885
text: I plan to leave the end of this story in the next revelation. {nl}Find my next revelation in the Mage Tower.

name: QUEST_20150317_000886
text: Laima

name: QUEST_20150317_000887
text: There are still more keys left to find. {nl}It's a relief that they are all secretly guarded by Maven's plan.

name: QUEST_20150317_000888
text: What once housed the goddesses is now filled with demons. {nl}Maven, the first bishop, would be very sad about this.

name: QUEST_20150317_000889
text: Insert the Relics that match each altar. {nl}Then you will be able to get Maven's first key.

name: QUEST_20150317_000890
text: First, prepare. {nl}The Wood Goblins will be attacking soon.

name: QUEST_20150317_000891
text: The Great Cathedral used to be where we worshiped the goddess. {nl}Now it's turned to a nest of demons...

name: QUEST_20150317_000892
text: It's the key. Go to the Veiniky Altar. {nl}Maven's device can be found there.

name: QUEST_20150317_000893
text: Naktis' servants have become disoriented.

name: QUEST_20150317_000894
text: I presume this is the key that releases the device at the Veiniky Altar.

name: QUEST_20150317_000895
text: The next device is at the Veiniky Altar.

name: QUEST_20150317_000896
text: This drug really better work...

name: QUEST_20150317_000897
text: This drug better work...

name: QUEST_20150317_000898
text: Food... Did you bring food?

name: QUEST_20150317_000899
text: Did you see the pilgrim with never-ending hunger? {nl}He's also under Naktis' curse. {nl}That's why his hunger can't be filled, no matter how much he eats.

name: QUEST_20150317_000900
text: Ugghh... What did I eat? {nl}I feel sick.

name: QUEST_20150317_000901
text: The drug better work...

name: QUEST_20150317_000902
text: They're feeling nauseous? {nl}I can't tell if the drug is working just by looking at their reactions.

name: QUEST_20150317_000903
text: I'll give you the drug. {nl}Give it to the pilgrims.

name: QUEST_20150317_000904
text: Now I better go and bury the bishop.

name: QUEST_20150317_000905
text: Thank you for helping me bury the bishop.

name: QUEST_20150317_000906
text: Red Marble

name: QUEST_20150317_000907
text: It's emitting red light.

name: QUEST_20150317_000908
text: Blue Marble

name: QUEST_20150317_000909
text: It's emitting blue light.

name: QUEST_20150317_000910
text: Yellow Marble

name: QUEST_20150317_000911
text: It's emitting yellow light.

name: QUEST_20150317_000912
text: Green Marble

name: QUEST_20150317_000913
text: It's emitting green light.

name: QUEST_20150317_000914
text: Purple Marble

name: QUEST_20150317_000915
text: It's emitting purple light.

name: QUEST_20150317_000916
text: It's time to let Naktis' servants know about the location of Maven's device.

name: QUEST_20150317_000917
text: Maven's device will not be destroyed easily but that doesn't mean it's indestructible.

name: QUEST_20150317_000918
text: Naktis' servants are showing strong obsession {nl}over their own things inside Maven's device.

name: QUEST_20150317_000919
text: Naktis' servants are showing strong obsession {nl}over the things inside Maven's device.

name: QUEST_20150317_000920
text: Have you found the last key?

name: QUEST_20150317_000921
text: If Naktis' servants took it, then the last key must be in the hands of Naktis.

name: QUEST_20150317_000922
text: Naktis' servants have reported to her that we have the key.

name: QUEST_20150317_000923
text: The shining keys and marbles...

name: QUEST_20150317_000924
text: The color of the shining keys and marbles... {nl}they seem to match each other and are related.

name: QUEST_20150317_000925
text: It seems something reacted.

name: QUEST_20150317_000926
text: We are the priests sent to undo Naktis' curse at Pilgrim's Way. {nl}We are looking for the many documents about the demons and their curse in the Cathedral.

name: QUEST_20150317_000927
text: The device will be released when all the floor plates are pressed down.

name: QUEST_20150317_000928
text: Take the bombs from the chest. You must destroy the entrance of the Royal Mausoleum.

name: QUEST_20150317_000929
text: Help!

name: QUEST_20150317_000930
text: Warning

name: QUEST_20150317_000931
text: Stop! You cannot go beyond this point without permission!

name: QUEST_20150317_000932
text: What? You seem a bit inexperienced but still may be of help to us. {nl}You'll be able to meet the officer when you follow this road.

name: QUEST_20150317_000933
text: What the...! Losing the revelation right in front of...! {nl}This isn't the end! Remember that!

name: QUEST_20150317_000934
text: Well then, let's start the experiment.

name: QUEST_20150317_000935
text: Spoiled Food

name: QUEST_20150317_000936
text: (Potato dumplings. It feels like I shouldn't eat them.{nl}Chow down?)

name: QUEST_20150317_000937
text: (It's spoiled.)

name: QUEST_20150317_000938
text: Preserved food

name: QUEST_20150317_000939
text: (It's preserved food that is dried or salted.{nl}Doesn't seem edible by itself.)

name: QUEST_20150317_000940
text: Liquor

name: QUEST_20150317_000941
text: (Just smells like liquor.)

name: QUEST_20150317_000942
text: Explore

name: QUEST_20150317_000943
text: It seems like it can be used only in the Crystal Mine 3F...

name: QUEST_20150317_000944
text: Found a piece of paper underneath the soil.

name: QUEST_20150317_000945
text: Eating more would be rather risky.

name: QUEST_20150317_000946
text: Something feels horrible inside...

name: QUEST_20150317_000947
text: Oooh...

name: QUEST_20150317_000948
text: I don't want to eat that ever again.

name: QUEST_20150317_000949
text: This is dangerous. I want to throw up!!

name: QUEST_20150317_000950
text: (There seem to be a lot of interesting books. {nl}Which one shall I read?)

name: QUEST_20150317_000951
text: Wonders of the Deep Forests

name: QUEST_20150317_000952
text: Many wooden owl statues of unknown purpose are found deep within forests.

name: QUEST_20150317_000953
text: Legend says that a sculptor made the statues to help guide dead souls.

name: QUEST_20150317_000954
text: It is said he has hidden for centuries and is still sculpting statues.

name: QUEST_20150317_000955
text: Fallen City of the Kingdom

name: QUEST_20150317_000956
text: The Millenary was held for the thousand year anniversary of the Kingdom.

name: QUEST_20150317_000957
text: A hundred years later, the Divine Tree rose up at the center of the capital, {nl}and disaster struck. The world was ravaged by plants.

name: QUEST_20150317_000958
text: The capital was filled with the anguished cries of people, {nl}and soon turned into a fallen city.

name: QUEST_20150317_000959
text: Monsters

name: QUEST_20150317_000960
text: Before Medzio Diena, there were only Vubbes.

name: QUEST_20150317_000961
text: But after, monsters with distinct and ferocious characteristics showed up in packs.

name: QUEST_20150317_000962
text: Siauliai Companies

name: QUEST_20150317_000963
text: The main industry of Siauliai is mining, and its specialty is crystals from the Crystal Mine.

name: QUEST_20150317_000964
text: Currently only the 1st Mine Lot is being worked on, but the mines used to have two lots.

name: QUEST_20150317_000965
text: The 2nd Mine Lot was closed by the declaration of the bishop to seal away demons. {nl}The alchemist also resides in the village for this reason.

name: QUEST_20150317_000966
text: Summa Theologica

name: QUEST_20150317_000967
text: Everything about the Statue of Goddess Vakarine is beautiful, {nl}but its most beautiful part is the fact that its special powers {nl}can be used to take you to the world of the goddesses.

name: QUEST_20150317_000968
text: Legend of Cunningham

name: QUEST_20150317_000969
text: It is a story old enough to be lost from all memory.

name: QUEST_20150317_000970
text: During his compulsory labor in the mines,{nl}Cunningham met a strange girl that was around seven years old.{nl}The girl kept speaking of a great danger,{nl}but knew little about it herself.

name: QUEST_20150317_000971
text: Cunningham took pity on the girl and cared for her. Soon they became best friends.

name: QUEST_20150317_000972
text: But the happiness did not last long; soon the demons attacked the mines. {nl}With the help of the girl, Cunningham fought against the demons to repel Mirtis.

name: QUEST_20150317_000973
text: However, Mirtis was too strong and Cunningham had to make a tough decision.

name: QUEST_20150317_000974
text: In the end, Cunningham destroyed the mines, sealing Mirtis and himself in it.

name: QUEST_20150317_000975
text: Surgery Book Set

name: QUEST_20150317_000976
text: People did not forgive the family for waking up the sleeping demons. {nl}People chased away the family in fear of being corrupted {nl}and the family had to roam the kingdom with the people's oppression and discrimination.

name: QUEST_20150317_000977
text: The men of that family had a weird sickness. {nl}Their skin was dry and flaking,{nl}and they kept on scratching it as if they were in pain.

name: QUEST_20150317_000978
text: The skin cracked like the surface of dry earth, with blood and pus flowing out. {nl}They were in pain for a very long time and were unable to sleep. {nl}They were constantly in a state of nervous breakdown.

name: QUEST_20150317_000979
text: Kingdom Travelogue

name: QUEST_20150317_000980
text: Rhombuspaving Dale is a masterpiece of the goddess of wonder and nature. {nl}The lime stairs encompassing the southern land is filled with spring water and glows fantastically.

name: QUEST_20150317_000981
text: The color of the spring is sometimes sapphire and other times, jade green. {nl}Looking at their profound and mysterious colors makes you wonder if this is the work of the goddess.

name: QUEST_20150317_000982
text: My Confession

name: QUEST_20150317_000983
text: The many deaths of demons could not fill the emptiness in my heart. {nl}Once the goddess' great mission for me is over, I will be left with a long life full of boring moments.

name: QUEST_20150317_000984
text: In that case, I shall try to interpret{nl}the goddess' revelation for the rest of my remaining life.{nl}If this goes against her will, the goddess should punish me right now.

name: QUEST_20150317_000985
text: But it will give me the chance to look back at my life. {nl}And in the long run, it could help a Revelator who shows up in the future.

name: QUEST_20150317_000986
text: Reading Desk

name: QUEST_20150317_000987
text: (There are some books on the shelves below the reading desk.{nl}Which book shall I read?)

name: QUEST_20150317_000988
text: (It's too old and worn to look at.)

name: QUEST_20150317_000989
text: The 4th of X {nl} - {nl} There's been very little traffic coming to town from the capital. {nl} When one family moved in, the whole village threw a welcome party. {nl} After all, how many outsiders do we get to meet these days? {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_000990
text: I might not know for what reason people would come all the way out here, {nl} but after Medzio Diena, it feels great to be in such a cheerful town. {nl} I might skip work tomorrow and party along. {nl} {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_000991
text: The 5th of X {nl} - {nl} I wanted to befriend my new neighbors as soon as possible so I brought some potato dumplings over. {nl}At the door, I could hear the house rattle. My neighbor then appeared, expressionless, {nl}but then had a cheerful expression when he saw the potato dumplings. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_000992
text: He apologized for his lack of spirit before, as he and his son were putting up wallpaper. {nl} What a harmonious family, I wonder if I could create something like that?

name: QUEST_20150317_000993
text: The 10th of X {nl} - {nl} Mr. Raman, who lived at the bank of the creek opposite from us, went on leave. His wife said he was off to get firewood. {nl} Well, for a long time he was gone in Klaipeda. {nl}I've heard that you can find a lot of beautiful girls in Klaipeda. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_000994
text: The 13th of X {nl} - {nl} Today was Goddess Origin Day, but somehow everyone in town had stomach pains, and could not celebrate. Why this happened specifically on this day I do not know. {nl}Well, illnesses will be illnesses. After all that, we had to make potato porridge. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_000995
text: The 14th of X {nl} - {nl} Last night I had an argument with my little sister. {nl}Writing down what you really think isn't that embarrassing. After what happened, {nl}I made a necklace as a present to her, and she came back to me. {nl}Well, I had to give in eventually. Even so, on one morning, she disappeared to somewhere. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_000996
text: Ah, just now my neighbor made me some delicious porridge. {nl} In return I made them some warm soup. I can cook too, you know? {nl}Tonight will be another feast so I'm going to make sure to eat and drink plenty.

name: QUEST_20150317_000997
text: The 16th of X {nl} - {nl} I got a stomachache drinking soup that I didn't know already went bad. {nl} I double-checked the smell before eating it, but there was no bad odor. {nl}I felt horrible inside so I went to the well for water. Even with the water, I continued to feel horrible. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_000998
text: I've been throwing up a lot lately but it seems to be getting better now. {nl}Tomorrow I'm going to go see Mr. Gordon to get some medicinal herbs. {nl} My little sister still hasn't come back yet. When I go to her room, I find no clothes. Even Mr. Man is getting worried.

name: QUEST_20150317_000999
text: The 17th of X {nl} - {nl} The village was eerily quiet today. {nl}There are no signs of the people who went earlier to get herbs from Mr. Gordon.

name: QUEST_20150317_001000
text: The 23rd of X {nl} - {nl} This might be the last time I get to write in this diary. {nl} Lyliana, you are the only family I have left in this world... {nl} Please be alive somewhere... {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001001
text: {nl}(There is something written, but it's all jumbled up and has ceased to be legible.)

name: QUEST_20150317_001002
text: Unknown Date {nl} - {nl}Several days must've passed. {nl}I've been on the run for around two days now without food or sleep. {nl}The people who fled to Klaipeda were all caught and killed. {nl}I don't even know how many are still alive and can walk. {nl}Everything is as quiet as the shadows, yet moving at a quick pace. We are all tense from fear of attack.

name: QUEST_20150317_001003
text: They did not wish for any uproar or disorder. {nl}They are not people. {nl}We must somehow notify Klaipeda. {nl}A last resort would be to abandon everything we can't use and move out.

name: QUEST_20150317_001004
text: Oh. It's you. {nl}This is our army base camp, so feel free to relax.

name: QUEST_20150317_001005
text: Have you already met the other soldiers? {nl}Hmm... What's your name?

name: QUEST_20150317_001006
text: Alright, thanks. You guys are working hard. {nl}I want to talk to my aides. Where are they?

name: QUEST_20150317_001007
text: Do you have something to say?

name: QUEST_20150317_001008
text: Send the two from the entrance to the front lines? {nl}Ha, that's nonsense. Did they ask you for that?

name: QUEST_20150317_001009
text: It's you? That would bother me. {nl}Hmm... I'm thankful that you are willing to join the front lines even when you can have it easier here...

name: QUEST_20150317_001010
text: I hate people who lack responsibility. {nl}Are there people who can take over your positions?

name: QUEST_20150317_001011
text: I like your spirit. {nl}But that doesn't mean I can take you in without question.

name: QUEST_20150317_001012
text: We are the undefeated unit of Raimondas. {nl}I only accept the best soldiers I can find.

name: QUEST_20150317_001013
text: By the way, are you going to take this guy as well?

name: QUEST_20150317_001014
text: I don't know what he does, but please keep this in mind: {nl}War is not a joke. I'll let you take him if you're willing to work with him in battle.

name: QUEST_20150317_001015
text: Damn, I thought it would die after getting its throat cut. {nl}I hope it can just behave and die slowly now.

name: QUEST_20150317_001016
text: Oops. I was late this time. Well, it doesn't matter that much. {nl}Soon my masterpiece will be complete. I hope you guys like it.

name: QUEST_20150317_001017
text: Unknown Demon

name: QUEST_20150317_001018
text: Ah... I almost forgot. I'll be taking this guy along!

name: QUEST_20150317_001019
text: I can feel Laima's power.

name: QUEST_20150317_001020
text: This pain I haven't felt for a long time...

name: QUEST_20150317_001021
text: Even so, I will not waste my power on you.

name: QUEST_20150317_001022
text: I guess the real revelation is in the chapel? {nl}That Laima could only prepare this much. Such a pity.

name: QUEST_20150317_001023
text: This is the Seal of Space...{nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001024
text: We will need the Revelator.

name: QUEST_20150317_001025
text: The Revelator has came here alone. {nl}Exactly what I wanted.

name: QUEST_20150317_001026
text: For what purpose did you come to this cursed city? {nl}Please go back if you have nothing in particular to attend to.

name: QUEST_20150317_001027
text: So you are the famous Revelator. The Knights of Kaliss are looking for competent people like you. {nl}If you're here to help them, I'll temporarily permit your entrance.

name: QUEST_20150317_001028
text: But please don't forget. The right to enter here belongs to our soldiers. {nl}We hope you don't create unnecessary trouble.

name: QUEST_20150317_001029
text: Salister... What are you even talking about? {nl}That's absurd...

name: QUEST_20150317_001030
text: The Symbol of Silt is in my hands thanks to you.{nl}If I pass this symbol to the dumb Royal Army or the Knights of Kaliss, they're going to give me more shifts on watch.

name: QUEST_20150317_001031
text: Only an ambitious and clever man such as I could unleash this object's true potential.

name: QUEST_20150317_001032
text: I will now use the power of Petrification and Ice to awaken this centuries-old power. {nl} Please stay there and observe.

name: QUEST_20150317_001033
text: I will help keep the Spirits of Time off of you!

name: QUEST_20150317_001034
text: What's happening? {nl}It's coming this way! Watch out!

name: QUEST_20150317_001035
text: Are you headed to the Great Cathedral, Revelator? {nl}Be careful! The demons have surrounded us!

name: QUEST_20150317_001036
text: The barrier is up and running. {nl}Please deal with Gesti while I activate the Divine Sphere.

name: QUEST_20150317_001037
text: If she's not on the first floor, then she must be on the second. {nl}I hope we're not too late.

name: QUEST_20150317_001038
text: This is my friend, Donatas. {nl}I will go up first to figure out Gesti's movements, so come up once you're ready.

name: QUEST_20150317_001039
text: Hey! You shouldn't come here!

name: QUEST_20150317_001040
text: So the Peltasta Master sent it... Ah, so this is what those cowardly miners were talking about.

name: QUEST_20150317_001041
text: No worries at all. I'm not scared. They're all fake rumors. {nl}It's no surprise the mine is shaking.

name: QUEST_20150317_001042
text: Request Bulletin Board

name: QUEST_20150317_001043
text: Here are all gathered requests. {nl}Caution: We are not responsible for the rewards of these requests.

name: QUEST_20150317_001044
text: Employee Brendon

name: QUEST_20150317_001045
text: I will show you the registered requests so far. {nl}You know that a day has to pass in order to receive a request again, even if you give up on it, right?

name: QUEST_20150317_001046
text: (Temporary) Request Manager

name: QUEST_20150317_001047
text: Select Request Start/End

name: QUEST_20150317_001048
text: Employee Ramda

name: QUEST_20150317_001049
text: The requests I look over are somewhat different from other requests. {nl}I promise there are clear rewards for you and your party members.

name: QUEST_20150317_001050
text: Great Merchant Gilliam

name: QUEST_20150317_001051
text: Are you ready to start the next stage?

name: QUEST_20150317_001052
text: Officer

name: QUEST_20150317_001053
text: I will guide you to where I believe your abilities are most needed.

name: QUEST_20150317_001054
text: There was a sudden increase of monsters in West Siauliai Woods. {nl}We need your help, urgently.

name: QUEST_20150317_001055
text: Vubbes are pouring out of the Crystal Mine. {nl}The Miner's Village needs your help.

name: QUEST_20150317_001056
text: A wicked aura has descended upon Silverstream Gorge, signaling an invasion by demons. {nl}Scouts and Paladin followers have been blocking their advance, but desperately need your help.

name: QUEST_20150317_001057
text: Monsters are attacking the Tenet Church. {nl}Paladin followers are blocking their attacks, but they will soon fall without any help.

name: QUEST_20150317_001058
text: Strange things are happening at Grass Brookside. {nl}All the villagers have gone missing and monsters now occupy the village.

name: QUEST_20150317_001059
text: There's a dark aura forming at Gate Route. {nl}If we don't get rid of that aura, thorny vines will cover the forest.

name: QUEST_20150317_001060
text: Please help the historians at Gateway of Great King. {nl}Monsters are chasing them since they've found a clue about Medzio Diena.

name: QUEST_20150317_001061
text: Zachariel, the Great King's tomb is being ruined by a horde. {nl}The tomb will be destroyed by the demons if you don't fight them.

name: QUEST_20150317_001062
text: Monsters are obstructing the entrance at High Crooked Road. {nl}If these monsters are not taken care of, then the cities and villages will be isolated.

name: QUEST_20150317_001063
text: Demons have invaded Mage Tower. {nl}We need your help quickly.

name: QUEST_20150317_001064
text: We need help at the entrance of Kateen Forest. {nl}We should be able to take the forest back from the monsters, but we'll need more support and manpower.

name: QUEST_20150317_001065
text: We need support to clear a path from Soul Peak to Gateway of Great King. {nl}Please assist us.

name: QUEST_20150317_001066
text: There's been a disaster at the Starving Demon's Way. {nl}Please send assistance quickly.

name: QUEST_20150317_001067
text: The Great Cathedral is being ruined by a menacing horde. {nl}The Cathedral will soon collapse without your support.

name: QUEST_20150317_001069
text: 171 [Farmland47]

name: QUEST_20150317_001070
text: 178 [Demon Prison]

name: QUEST_20150317_001071
text: 189 [Farmland49]

name: QUEST_20150317_001072
text: 196 [Demon Prison54_1]

name: QUEST_20150317_001073
text: 198 [Siauliai46]

name: QUEST_20150317_001074
text: 208 [Thorn Forest39]

name: QUEST_20150317_001076
text: 226 [Area of Ruins37_1, 2, 3]

name: QUEST_20150317_001077
text: Monsters are advancing toward the cursed limestone city. {nl}The dispatched troops are doing whatever they can to resist, but the curse is making the situation dire.

name: QUEST_20150317_001078
text: 245 [Fortress of the Land]

name: QUEST_20150317_001079
text: Revelation of Mage Tower

name: QUEST_20150317_001080
text: This is an old story of Fedimian before the Goddess Statue was built.

name: QUEST_20150317_001081
text: A long time ago, the people of Fedimian were quite normal, {nl}not much different from the ordinary people of the rest of the world. {nl}However, the people of Fedimian did differ from their worldly peers in one aspect.

name: QUEST_20150317_001082
text: The people of Fedimian were very cautious.{nl}In the sense that they take the word 'cautious' much more seriously. {nl}These people were as cautious around fire as they were without.

name: QUEST_20150317_001083
text: The Fedimians were modest about this with others. {nl}Even those who stayed at Fedimian for a while could not pick up the trait.

name: QUEST_20150317_001084
text: Thanks to this behavior, the people of Fedimian fared better during tough times, {nl}as they were able to sense danger coming.

name: QUEST_20150317_001085
text: Because of this, no few words were said about the cautiousness of the Fedimian people.

name: QUEST_20150317_001086
text: In Fedimian, if someone dropped money on the ground, it would be gone forever. {nl}In a world where money mostly consists of silver coins, {nl}only the creditors would know exactly how much money has been lost in this manner.

name: QUEST_20150317_001087
text: Why money disappears into the ground at Fedimian remains unknown. {nl}Some people believe the Goddess Zemyna absorbs any money that makes contact with her area. {nl}Most commoners, however, believe this was done to reduce the demand of silver coins from creditors.

name: QUEST_20150317_001088
text: By believing that the goddess herself takes the silver,{nl}the people found it pointless to try and dig it up in her grounds. {nl}The fact that you can offer silver coins at Fedimian as tribute to her reinforces this idea.

name: QUEST_20150317_001089
text: In any case, the fact that one could lose money by dropping it on Fedimian soil {nl}has made Fedimians very careful in handling their money.

name: QUEST_20150317_001090
text: However, as much as one tries to be careful, mistakes still happen. {nl}More so with the case of young girls. {nl}One day, it happened to a girl named Aiste.

name: QUEST_20150317_001091
text: Normally, when one drops silver coins on the ground, it would scatter about on the road, {nl}and then disappear without a trace. {nl}{nl}Fedimians usually curse their own carelessness and move on, {nl}but Aiste was different: she wondered why and how it happened.

name: QUEST_20150317_001092
text: To find out what happened, Aiste began inspecting the area she lost her coins at. {nl}In her search she came across a beggar beside the deep end of the canal.

name: QUEST_20150317_001093
text: Aiste asked the elderly beggar, {nl}'Did you by any chance pick up the silver coins I dropped? {nl}{nl}Would you return them to me?{nl}I worked very hard everyday for those coins and really need them.'

name: QUEST_20150317_001094
text: The beggar was taken aback. Aiste was asking for the impossible. {nl}After all, finding dropped coins in Fedimian was unthinkable. {nl}The old beggar was about to explain this to Aiste, but instead remarked, {nl}'I've also lost coins in this area. It would be nice if you looked for mine as you searched for yours.'

name: QUEST_20150317_001095
text: Almost immediately, the beggar felt guilty of the mocking words he blurted out. He apologized to Aiste.

name: QUEST_20150317_001096
text: Why don't you go to where you work and explain what happened to them? Make sure you look lost.' The beggar then hesitantly added, {nl}'In the meantime, I'll be looking for your silver coins here.'

name: QUEST_20150317_001097
text: Upon hearing the beggar's words, Aiste thanked the beggar, and went on to follow his advice. {nl}Through his selfless act, the beggar suddenly felt a revived sense of responsibility. He looked toward the silhouette of the leaving Aiste, his heart heavy and warm from this experience.

name: QUEST_20150317_001098
text: Aiste went to the orchards at the outskirts of Fedimian where she worked. {nl}While one could just pick fruit from the trees there, it was also important to take the fruit that fell on the ground.

name: QUEST_20150317_001099
text: Smaller hands worked better for picking fruits, so young children were often hired at the orchards. {nl}Some orchards took it a step further: hiring monkeys, whose hands were smaller than that of children, to pick fruit. Monkeys did work more effectively than children, but often ate the fruit they picked. Thus, most owners relied on hiring children.

name: QUEST_20150317_001100
text: Returning, Aiste visited the orchard she worked at and explained her situation to the orchard owner. {nl}Unfortunately, the owner was not in a good mood, having just had a quarrel with his wife. {nl}He, like all other Fedimians, knew about the phenomenon, and saw no reason to give Aiste more money.

name: QUEST_20150317_001101
text: And so he said, {nl}'Just as you've been able to pick up all my fruit, you should be able to find your lost money at Fedimian, so do not tell me to give you a second pay.' {nl}The orchard owner's cold words brought tears to the girl's eyes. {nl}The sight broke his heart, but even so, he did not want to give her any more money.

name: QUEST_20150317_001102
text: He was soon overtaken by guilt and said, {nl}'If you really need that money, you should go to the silversmith's.'

name: QUEST_20150317_001103
text: Aiste set towards the silversmith's place as soon as she heard those words. {nl}Fortunately, the house was located outside Fedimian walls. {nl}Had it been inside, the silversmith ran the risk of losing his money and silverware to the soil.

name: QUEST_20150317_001104
text: It is for this reason that he lives on the outskirts of Fedimian. {nl}Aiste knocked on the front door and explained her situation to him as soon as he answered.

name: QUEST_20150317_001105
text: The silversmith, after hearing Aiste's story, stated, {nl}'Even for children it is foolish to be so careless. How could you not know that all money that falls on Fedimian soil disappears, never to be found again?'

name: QUEST_20150317_001106
text: Aiste was surprised by what the silversmith said and grew sad. {nl}After a while she asked, {nl}'Then why is it that such a cruel thing happens?'

name: QUEST_20150317_001107
text: Even the silversmith did not know the true answer, so he improvised, {nl}'Goddess Zemyna must be taking them.'

name: QUEST_20150317_001108
text: Hearing those words, Aiste replied, {nl}'Then I will just have to go ask the goddess.' {nl}The silversmith was astounded and replied, {nl}'While you're at it, why don't you ask the goddess to return my silverware?'

name: QUEST_20150317_001109
text: The silversmith did not take to heart his own words, but Aiste did. {nl}She immediately set out to do as she said. The silversmith felt sorry for Aiste, {nl}but did not have the courage to call her back as she faded into the distance.

name: QUEST_20150317_001110
text: An exhausted Aiste soon arrived at Zemyna's Goddess Statue. {nl}She prostrated herself before it and prayed to the Goddess Statue, her head completely down. {nl}'Oh, Goddess. Please return my lost silver coins.' {nl}Soon, while offering her prayers, Aiste could no longer hold in her sadness and she finally wept.

name: QUEST_20150317_001111
text: How long did she pray crying? {nl}Suddenly, Aiste heard a voice addressed to her. {nl}'My child, have you come to take back what you have lost?'

name: QUEST_20150317_001112
text: Aiste knew in her heart that it was Goddess Zemyna that was addressing her. {nl}She stopped crying, cleared her voice and replied so.

name: QUEST_20150317_001113
text: The goddess' voice was heard again. {nl}'Aiste, what you're asking of me is not by a method I approve of. Where I reign there is no harvest nor fruits for those who do not work.'

name: QUEST_20150317_001114
text: But I worked very hard today!'

name: QUEST_20150317_001115
text: I know. So instead, I will give you and the others a chance. Look under your feet.'

name: QUEST_20150317_001116
text: The goddess' voice faded with those words, and Aiste found silver coins under her feet. {nl}She looked to where she had left her silvers and found that the tears she shed had transformed into coins.{nl}Aiste was very happy, and made sure to pick up all the silver before leaving.

name: QUEST_20150317_001117
text: After a number of steps, Aiste thought about the silversmith, {nl}and, again, went to his house and knocked on his door. {nl}As if the silversmith was waiting for her return, he opened the door immediately and said. {nl}'I'm sorry. I regret sending you away like that. I'll give you some silver. {nl}This time, be careful not to drop any and get home safely.'

name: QUEST_20150317_001118
text: As the silversmith held out his silver coins, Aiste shook her head and said,{nl}'No thank you, the goddess returned all my coins. On top of that, she gave me even more. {nl}I remembered you saying you had also lost silver, so I came to give you my extra coins. You don't need to give me yours.'

name: QUEST_20150317_001119
text: At first, the silversmith was skeptical about the coins being returned, {nl}so he was surprised when Aiste showed him genuine coins. After thinking for a while, the silversmith said, {nl}'Then how about this. You give me what you want while you accept what I was about to give you. {nl}Isn't that fair? On top of that I'll give you a pouch to carry your extra silver.'

name: QUEST_20150317_001120
text: Aiste obliged and gave her extra coins to the silversmith. {nl}After this, the silversmith gave Aiste a bag of coins.

name: QUEST_20150317_001121
text: After leaving the silversmith's house, {nl}Aiste suddenly remembered that the old beggar must still be looking for her lost coins and worried for him. {nl}On her way to the beggar, she met the orchard owner again. {nl}Upon seeing Aiste, the orchard owner was overjoyed. {nl}'I was looking for you. I'm sorry for sending you off earlier. As an apology, I'll give you your salary again. {nl}Please be careful not to lose it this time.'

name: QUEST_20150317_001122
text: The orchard owner took out a large amount of coins, more than what Aiste's salary was, and handed it to her. {nl}However, Aiste shook her head and said, {nl}'Goddess Zemyna already returned my money to me. The silversmith also helped me, so now I actually have too much. {nl}Here, take a look.'

name: QUEST_20150317_001123
text: Saying that, Aiste opened the bag of coins she got from the silversmith and showed the orchard owner. {nl}The orchard owner was extremely surprised, as the amount of money she got from the goddess and the silversmith surpassed the amount he had.

name: QUEST_20150317_001124
text: Disregarding the amount Aiste had shown him, the orchard owner said, {nl}'Well, even so, I would be ashamed for not giving you my due, so please just take it.' {nl}After saying this, the orchard owner stuffed his coins into Aiste's bag and left. {nl}By the time Aiste could muster up the energy to call the orchard owner, he was too far away.

name: QUEST_20150317_001125
text: She hesitated for a moment but then set her mind on the beggar. {nl}After a bit of walking, Aiste arrived at where they met. The old beggar spotted her first and hurried over to her. {nl}He showed her the silver coins he was clenching onto and said, 'Look! I found your lost silver.' {nl}Aiste received the beggar's silver and then showed the beggar her bag and said, {nl}'Look, I found your silver coins too.'

name: QUEST_20150317_001126
text: Even though the beggar was exhausted, he cupped his hands to get his coins back. {nl}Seeing this, Aiste was brought to the brink of tears. {nl}She wondered how much begging the beggar had to do to give her her coins back. {nl}With a heavy heart, Aiste gave the old beggar the coins.

name: QUEST_20150317_001127
text: After that, Aiste also held out her bag and said, {nl}'This is a gift as thanks for looking for my silver. I was given this through Goddess Zemyna's grace.' {nl}Aiste then left before the Old Beggar could figure out how to reply.

name: QUEST_20150317_001128
text: The beggar looked towards Aiste's distant shadow, and opened the present she gave him, {nl}curious to what was inside. Inside, he was surprised to find dozens of silver coins. {nl}Now he understood why Aiste was able to depart much more quickly than she arrived - she had lightened her load by giving him the excess.

name: QUEST_20150317_001129
text: For a beggar who had been stingy over a single silver coin, the fact Aiste could simply give away several tens of times that amount moved him. {nl}The fact that Aiste, who had went off and solved the mystery of Fedimian, came back and gave him what she really didn't owe, made the beggar thankful.

name: QUEST_20150317_001130
text: The more he thought, the less the beggar was able to hold back his tears. {nl}As he cried, he noticed something odd - every shining teardrop that touched the ground transformed to silver coins.

name: QUEST_20150317_001131
text: The beggar could not believe his eyes, but quickly remembered Aiste words about a blessing from the goddess. {nl}After a while, the beggar stopped crying, and went to pick up the coins and put them in the bag Aiste gave him.

name: QUEST_20150317_001132
text: A few days later, the beggar went to the statue that Aiste prayed to. There, he took out one coin from the bag to keep, and offered the rest to the Goddess Statue. {nl}He then prayed to the goddess whole-heartedly and left. As the money he offered disappeared, the beggar again to shed tears, but that's another story.

name: QUEST_20150317_001133
text: After a few days, an odd rumor spread across Fedimian. {nl}The rumor claimed that silver no longer disappeared into Fedimian soil. {nl}The rumor did not sit well at first with older, experienced people, but some tested the rumor with a paltry amount of silver, {nl}and it turned out to be true. Everyone agreed that finally, the mysterious phenomenon of Fedimian has come to an end.

name: QUEST_20150317_001134
text: After some time, word of this occurrence reached the king. Curious as to why this happened, the king ordered an investigation. {nl}The hidden truth was brought to light, and Aiste's story was known.

name: QUEST_20150317_001135
text: The king praised the people that caused the miracle with their charitable hearts. {nl}Additionally, to honor the grace of the goddess, he decided to spend the national treasury to build a large statue dedicated to her.

name: QUEST_20150317_001136
text: On the day the statue was finally completed, {nl}something miraculous happened as the King and Aiste went together to make the first offering. {nl}From the circumference of the statue sprouted coins - all the silver coins that had been lost by Fedimians up until that time.

name: QUEST_20150317_001137
text: After heated debate, the Fedimian people decided to not to hoard their lost silver coins. {nl}Instead, they asked the king to collect all the coins and distribute them among the poor of the Kingdom. {nl}The king readily agreed, and gave the order to record this beautiful event into the history of the Kingdom.

name: QUEST_20150317_001138
text: Even now, nobody knows when and how the mysterious phenomenon of Fedimian started, {nl}but everybody knows when, how, and who helped unravel the mystery. {nl}It was through the kindness of Aiste and the people who helped her, as well as through the grace of the goddess, that the mystery came to an end.

name: QUEST_20150317_001139
text: The Gambler of Klaipeda

name: QUEST_20150317_001140
text: The Gambler of Klaipeda {nl}~A Short Story~

name: QUEST_20150317_001141
text: {nl}{nl}In the town of Klaipeda, there once lived a man by the name of Modestas. {nl}He was a good, honest man - but had one major flaw that his friends and family all worried about, his wife especially so. {nl}Modestas was not lazy nor very clever nor not too foolish. {nl}He did not drink or repeatedly get into fights. {nl}The man had one flaw, and it was that he loved to gamble.{nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001142
text: During the day, Modestas would work hard and would never let himself go hungry - {nl}but whenever he earned more than he really needed, he would gamble. {nl}The wife would always try to save this money, but not one extra coin would ever go toward their home.

name: QUEST_20150317_001143
text: Whenever she could, Modestas' wife would often go to the shrine, and pray to the goddess' likeness. {nl}But Modestas continued his odd habits, and the people around him grew increasingly concerned. {nl}After all, the mind of a gambler would think, 'Today it may be small, but tomorrow it could be big!' {nl}And so the days rolled by, same as they ever were, until one peculiar day.

name: QUEST_20150317_001144
text: Like most of his days, Modestas was heading home after gambling away his excess coins. {nl}He was walking through the Siauliai Woods on the path to Klaipeda, when he saw a strange, old woman on the road.

name: QUEST_20150317_001145
text: This old woman seemed not only old and frail, but had an unnerving aura around her. {nl}She was acting strangely, as if deep in thought or as if she was obsessed with whatever she was doing. {nl}Modestas thought about simply ignoring the woman and walking past. Nothing would have happened if he did that, {nl}but curiosity got the better of him.

name: QUEST_20150317_001146
text: To be precise, what really turned his head toward the old woman was what she held in her hands. {nl}Gold. The woman seemed to be obsessing over two gold pieces, doing something with them. {nl}Unable to hear her mumbling, Modestas drew closer to the strange woman.

name: QUEST_20150317_001147
text: Over the jingling sound of gold, the old woman muttered. {nl}'If these two pieces of gold could ever marry, the baby gold would make me rich... but there's no life in these things...' {nl}Modestas heard those words, and decided to comment. {nl}'That gold won't make you rich by itself, so just put it into something worthwhile. {nl}Do you really think muttering at gold will do something?'{nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001148
text: The old woman spoke plainly, 'Why not? If it works, this'll certainly be the most pleasant, risk-free way to wealth.' {nl}'That's ridiculous. You should do what I do and gamble.' {nl}The woman was incensed.

name: QUEST_20150317_001149
text: 'So, you think your betting ways are better?' {nl}'Why wouldn't I? There are moments where I could win or lose, but your way won't make any gold at all.' {nl}With Modestas' words, the old woman paused in thought. Finally, she said, {nl}'Then let's have a bet.'

name: QUEST_20150317_001150
text: The disturbing aura around her grew as soon as the offer reached Modestas' ears. He couldn't outright refuse. {nl}'What kind of bet?' {nl}'We'll see whether your way or my way will make us richer.' {nl}'And if I lose?'

name: QUEST_20150317_001151
text: 'Don't worry about that. You will win, and you will lose - that won't change. The rules are fixed.' {nl}'What do you mean by that?' {nl}'By taking my offer, you will fail once, and you will win once. No matter what happens.' {nl}'Well, yeah. Winning and losing is how gambling works.'

name: QUEST_20150317_001152
text: 'No. No matter how unlucky things may seem, you will win your first gamble. {nl}And then, no matter how favorable life may seem, you will fail the next.'

name: QUEST_20150317_001153
text: Modestas was still confused by these strange words. {nl}'So, you're saying I'll win on every odd bet, and lose on every even one?' {nl}'Yes. It will be so. You will win some, and then you won't. Is that not fair? {nl}One coin will be enough to succeed, no matter how many bets you make. That is my offer.' {nl}'You think I'll switch between winning and losing, huh?'{nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001154
text: With her hand to her chin, the old woman gave a puzzling response. {nl}'Three times each should be enough. Return to me after you make six gambles. {nl}Naturally, if you don't have more coin after your sixth bet, I will win.'

name: QUEST_20150317_001155
text: Modestas seemed to tremble. 'How much should I earn, then?' {nl}'You'll start with one gold piece,' she replied, 'and when you return, show me all your gold pieces but that one. {nl}If you stretch that single piece to anything more, then you win. As for time... you have one week.' {nl}'So, what do you get when I lose?' Modestas reminded her.{nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001156
text: 'Well...' the old woman lingered, 'If you win, everyone will know about my gold - {nl}and you'll have the power of winning and losing. On the other hand...' {nl}''On the other hand...'?' Modestas said, tensely.

name: QUEST_20150317_001157
text: 'After I win, the friends you know will disappear every time you lose a bet.' {nl}Modestas was unnerved by the conditions set. He did not immediately object; instead, he thought of victory, {nl}and soon accepted. Modestas was, most of all, the kind of person who never backed down.

name: QUEST_20150317_001158
text: As Modestas and the old woman parted ways, he, in any case, knew he now had a dangerous power guaranteeing his victory at any time in the near future. {nl}He walked, looking for the next person to bet huge on. As he wondered how much to wager on his next move, he heard the sound of galloping behind him.

name: QUEST_20150317_001159
text: Modestas turned around. It was his good old friend, Sigfried, riding on horseback towards him. {nl}They knew each other well, as both had been together through the highs and lows of gambling. They exchanged greetings and talked about where they were going. Sigfried dismounted to walk at a leisurely pace with his friend, idly chatting along their way. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001160
text: However, before long, Modestas could no longer continue walking with Sigfried. {nl}He was fully aware of his deadline, and had no time for such trivial activities. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001161
text: Even during their normal everyday conversations, Modestas and Sigfried unconsciously made big and small bets. Eventually, one would utter the word, 'Bet?' unconsciously. {nl}Neither of them were rich so these bets weren't ever that significant. Knowing this would trigger the curse, Modestas really wanted to ask Sigfried to leave. {nl}In the end, Modestas uttered these words: {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001162
text: 'Are you not busy? You seemed to be in a hurry on your horse before you passed by for a talk. You should stop worrying about me and go.' {nl}Sigfried, hearing Modestas' words, replied, {nl} 'I was busy, but I still have time to walk with you for another ten minutes or so. This horse might not look like much, but when it comes down to it, he can go pretty fast.' {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001163
text: Seeing Sigfried not budge, Modestas tried again to persuade him, {nl}'Wouldn't it be better to be early as opposed to be on time?' {nl}{nl}Hearing this, Sigfried became adamant, {nl}'Do you not believe what I just said, or are you willfully ignoring it all?' {nl}A disconcerted Modestas said, {nl}'No, I didn't mean it like that...' {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001164
text: However, before Modestas could say any more, Sigfried said, 'If you don't believe me, why don't we have a bet?' {nl}{nl}Naturally, the words, 'Sure. What do you want to wager?' rose up in Modestas' throat.

name: QUEST_20150317_001165
text: Considering Modestas' habit, to not immediately accept a gamble took superhuman willpower from him. {nl}'What... What kind of bet?' {nl}'We're going to bet on whether my horse is fast or not.' {nl}Modestas desperately fought against his inner gambler.

name: QUEST_20150317_001166
text: On the other hand, Sigfried was understandably confident, knowing with certainty that he would win the gamble, and was alright with betting his horse. {nl}With only a little money at hand, the bet became too good to refuse, and Modestas finally accepted. {nl}And, as expected, Modestas won. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001167
text: As soon as the bet started, Sigfried tried every method possible to command his horse to move. Despite his efforts, it didn't move a single hoof at all.{nl}At the end, Sigfried repeatedly cursed its strange behavior. Realizing he'd be late to his appointment without a horse, he threw the reins to Modestas and sprinted away.{nl}As Sigfried disappeared, Modestas felt uncomfortable.

name: QUEST_20150317_001168
text: For Modestas, who had always been elated upon winning bets and depressed upon losing them, to win and feel depressed was a first in his entire life. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001169
text: Knowing he had just deceived his long-time gambling friend, Sigfried, and also missed an opportunity to earn a lot of money, Modestas felt conflicted as he walked slowly alongside the horse he had just won. {nl}While walking, Modestas remembered the earlier warnings of his unconditional bet. He realized that now, with his upcoming defeat, he was doomed to not earn any more silver than he started with.

name: QUEST_20150317_001170
text: While walking along the road, Modestas encountered a group of soldiers. {nl}Upon looking closer, the soldiers seemed to be arguing about what to buy at a store. {nl}Modestas decided not to interfere and pass them, but the soldiers noticed him and called. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001171
text: 'You, the young man with the horse, can you come over and help us for a bit?' {nl}Modestas had no idea what these soldiers needed help for, but since he could no longer ignore them, he decided to head over. {nl}Once Modestas arrived, one of the soldiers said, {nl}'You came at just the right time. We would like you to referee a small gamble we're about to make here.' {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001172
text: Modestas was surprised when he heard the word, 'gamble', but was relieved to know he was only being asked to referee. After all, nothing could possibly happen if he was just refereeing. {nl}Modestas learned that the soldiers were fighting over which goddess was the best. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001173
text: What started as trivial banter turned into a big argument, which finally grew to become a big money bet. The soldiers had already gathered their money and only had to decide the winner. Unfortunately, every goddess got equal votes and a winner couldn't be decided.{nl}Thus, the soldiers decided to settle the bet by calling the first person who passed by, asking him who he thought the best goddess is, and deciding the winner from there. The soldiers agreed that the first passer-by would symbolize the will of whatever goddess he favored. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001174
text: The soldiers did not tell Modestas who voted for which goddess, for fear of his decision being affected by the expressions of each individual soldier. {nl}The soldiers did tell him however, how much they have each wagered. Just by seeing the gold nuggets, he could easily figure that there was a large amount of money in this bet. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001175
text: Since a big jackpot was on the line, the soldiers waited with bated breath for Modestas' answer. {nl}Knowing there was no right answer to the question, Modestas simply said aloud the name of his own favorite goddess. {nl}When he did, the soldiers reacted strangely. {nl}There was supposed to be an ecstatic winner and disappointed losers, but nobody seemed joyful nor disappointed. Instead, everyone had a bewildered look on their faces. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001176
text: Modestas, perplexed by their reaction, asked for an explanation to which one of the soldiers answered, {nl}'We originally had votes for four goddesses but your choice isn't any of them, so now we have five goddesses.' {nl}The soldiers then resumed their squabble about how to decide the winner. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001177
text: The mood began to deteriorate so Modestas wanted to leave. {nl}When he was about to take off, the soldiers blocked his path and accused him. {nl}'It's your fault the argument heated up even more. You're not thinking of just leaving are you?'{nl}Intimidated by the irritated soldiers, Modestas dared not to escape. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001178
text: In Modestas' mind, he concluded that the quarrelling soldiers didn't have him referee, but simply added him into the bet. In reality however, he had no real claim, so he wasn't in the bet just yet. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001179
text: Knowing Modestas, he could not simply sit on the sidelines watching a big bet grow. Eventually, he became enticed to join. Modestas, caught in the heat of the moment and ending up participating, finally remembered it was his turn to lose.{nl}But it was too late.{nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001180
text: In addition, because the other soldiers had already bet deeply, Modestas had to bet the only gold bullion he had. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001181
text: If you think about it, even if it was not his turn to lose, all it took for him do so was one more vote for any of the goddesses he didn't choose. With the odds of the next person walking by supporting his goddess being against him, the probability of winning was low anyway.{nl}{nl}However, the victor was chosen unexpectedly. An officer found the soldiers slacking, disciplined them and was about to lead them away. {nl}The soldiers, obeying the superior's command, were about to march off when they shrewdly asked him which goddess he favored. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001182
text: The officer inadvertently said the name of a goddess, and some of the soldiers began cheering. {nl}The officer, not knowing what was going on, simply ordered his soldiers to move along. In any case, Modestas certainly lost. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001183
text: Having now lost the gold bullion given to him by the strange old woman, Modestas was now at a loss. {nl}To originally intend to referee, only to end up losing all the gold he had, all while knowing exactly the reason why... Modestas felt heartbroken, dumbfounded, and yet, understanding. A unique feeling. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001184
text: Although Modestas had just lost money by entering a bet started by others, it was the first time he'd done so in his life. Modestas spent some time thinking of how to better his situation and {nl}suddenly got an idea, knowing he was certain to win his next bet. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001185
text: If he could call back the soldiers from earlier and bet his horse, he could certainly earn his gold back and possibly more. {nl}Knowing this, Modestas got on his horse, and sped in the direction the soldiers left towards. {nl}{nl}With speed, Modestas soon spotted a stationary wagon. Modestas lowered his speed to check out the wagon parked on the side of the road. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001186
text: Unfortunately, just as Modestas pulled up at the wagon, his horse suddenly grew agitated, forcing him off. Fortunately, because he had cut his speed and fell on muddy ground, he was not greatly injured. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001187
text: Someone approached Modestas who had been lying down, hurt, and helped him get back on his feet. He turned out to be one of the people standing on the side, the wagon owner. {nl}The man who helped Modestas uttered with relief, {nl}'I am glad you're not too hurt. Your horse also didn't hurt himself tripping over that pit.'{nl}Modestas noticed a well-hidden pit where he pointed. {nl}The wagon owner continued.{nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001188
text: 'My horse became injured here and can no longer pull my wagon. It's just an empty wagon, but at any rate, it won't be going anywhere for a while. That's why I have a proposition. Won't you sell me your horse? I believe, with a healthy horse pulling the wagon, even my injured horse can help pull it in some way.'{nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001189
text: It was an unexpected suggestion, but Modestas needed the horse to quickly find and catch up to the soldiers. He immediately refused the offer.{nl}The wagon owner tried to explain there was no way his injured horse can pull the wagon alone, but Modestas was not persuaded. After his repeated refusal, the wagon owner offered a new suggestion.{nl}'Then let's do this. What if you buy my wagon? I will sell it for cheap. Since my injured horse can't pull the wagon, it will be better off in your hands.'{nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001190
text: Modestas could see that the wagon was very durable, good-looking and has been well cared for. However, he had no immediate need for a wagon, so he hesitated. {nl}In addition, Modestas had no money now; no matter how low the wagon owner went, he did not have the money to buy it. {nl}

name: QUEST_20150317_001191
